prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Remedies for Breach of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: Pure disclosure without any improper use makes damages very difficult to quantify. If the defendant has disclosed secrets to another, the plaintiff should arguably be able to recover more than nominal damages. It should be noted that even if an injunction is granted against any further use, it may be difficult for the party receiving the confidential information to expunge from his or her memory a particular formula or client list which has been passed on.[1] The plaintiff should be compensated for the real possibility of future loss.
